briefing.opening: Good morning/afternoon/evening, everyone. I will now begin the climate briefing for December 25, 2025.

sections.title: ğŸ”´ Urgent Climate Warnings and Threats
sections.content: The government announced the '4th Climate Crisis Adaptation Plan,' issuing a serious warning that temperatures are expected to reach a critical threshold of a 2Â°C increase in 6-7 years [1]. In this crisis, the notion that 'climate crisis denial' stems from doubts created by pseudo-scientists poses a significant obstacle to effective climate response [2, 4]. The actual impacts of climate change are already materializing, with local Olympic hopefuls discussing its effects on winter sports [26], and reports continuing to emerge about the worsening drought conditions in the Colorado River due to climate change [28].

sections.title: ğŸ‡°ğŸ‡· Domestic Carbon Neutrality and Adaptation Efforts
sections.content: Domestically, amidst calls for the establishment of ecosystem accounts to address the climate crisis [3], various local governments and corporations are taking positive steps towards achieving carbon neutrality. Hankook Tire has earned the highest CDP Climate Change Response rating of 'A' for two consecutive years [5], and Pohang City in Gyeongbuk Province has been finally designated as a distributed energy specialized zone, accelerating its efforts towards carbon neutrality [6, 15]. Hwaseong Special City held the '2050 Carbon Neutrality-Green Growth Committee' to deliberate and approve the final draft of its climate crisis adaptation plan [7, 11, 16], while Gyeonggi Province is playing a leading role in carbon neutrality, RE100, and climate insurance, acting as a climate economy partner [8]. Carbon neutrality efforts are continuing across local communities, including Gongju City's 'Chungnam-type Carbon Neutrality Point System' incentive payments [9], Samcheok City's Prime Minister's Commendation for carbon neutrality achievements [10], and Uiseong County's demonstrated administrative performance in carbon neutrality and its second consecutive Gyeongbuk Environmental Award [12]. Concrete achievements are also being seen in the corporate sector, with Hyundai Motor and Kia obtaining approval for their greenhouse gas reduction plans from a global alliance [14, 19], and LG Electronics and Busan City collaborating on 'Marine Glass' commercialization to restore blue carbon and implement carbon neutrality [18]. Furthermore, the Ansan Environmental Foundation, as a carbon neutrality center, hosted a briefing on ESG management diagnostics and consulting for small and medium-sized enterprises [17], and discussions are underway at Busan Port regarding the supply of renewable energy as a measure for greenhouse gas reduction [21].

sections.title: ğŸŒ International Policy Changes and Renewable Energy Debates
sections.content: Internationally, policy initiatives to address climate change are continuing. In Hawaii, a new climate change tax on cruise ship passengers was upheld by a federal judge [23, 25, 29, 30, 32, 33, 34, 35], presenting a new model for securing climate finance. Meanwhile, complex discussions are unfolding regarding renewable energy, with reports of offshore wind power projects in the eastern U.S. being halted amid concerns that the U.S. could lose the AI hegemony war to China, with renewable energy being cited as a contributing factor [20, 22]. However, an opinion piece put forth a positive argument that a future resilient to floods is possible even as climate change progresses [24], emphasizing the importance of climate adaptation strategies.

sections.title: ğŸŒ¿ Ecosystem and Species Climate Adaptation
sections.content: Research findings on the adaptation capabilities of ecosystems and species to climate change are also noteworthy. According to one study, there is a possibility that polar bears are evolving in response to climate change [27], and further analysis suggests they may possess resilience to climate change at the DNA level, which could influence extinction risk assessments [31]. This provides important insights into both the impact of climate change on biodiversity and the potential adaptive capacity of species, indicating the need for in-depth consideration in developing ecosystem conservation strategies.

briefing.closing: Today's briefing highlighted the urgency of the climate crisis, along with various domestic and international response efforts, and the adaptation processes of ecosystems. This is a time that requires continuous attention and effort. This concludes the climate briefing for December 25, 2025.

articles.description: On the 22nd (local time), components such as substructures and blades for wind power generation facilities, necessary for the construction of a wind power plant, were laid out at the Portsmouth Marine Terminal in Virginia, USA. The Donald Trump administration halted offshore wind power development plans in the eastern U.S. on that day. An analysis emerged suggesting that the U.S., engaged in an AI hegemony war with China, could lose due to the energy sources required for AI. China...

summary.phenomenon: On the 22nd (local time), wind power generation facility components were laid out at the Portsmouth Marine Terminal in Virginia, USA; however, the Donald Trump administration halted offshore wind power development plans in the eastern U.S. on that day.
summary.outlook: An analysis has been raised suggesting that the U.S. could lose the AI hegemony war with China due to issues related to the energy sources required for artificial intelligence (AI).
